channel.title: BBC News - Scotland
channel.copyright: Copyright: (C) British Broadcasting Corporation, see http://news.bbc.co.uk/2/hi/help/rss/4498287.stm for terms and conditions of reuse.

item.title: GPs in Scotland warn of rush back to face-to-face appointments
item.description: Doctors say the move, which is key to the government's NHS Recovery Plan, should only happen when it is safe to do so.

item.title: Covid in Scotland: Where are the latest cases?
item.description: A daily update on the number and location of coronavirus cases in Scotland.

item.title: Boy, two, injured in Caithness crash dies in hospital
item.description: Iain Mackay, two, was one of four people injured in a two-car crash on the A99 in Caithness.

item.title: Covid travel: Seven locations moved to Covid travel green list
item.description: Canada and Denmark go on the green list while Thailand and Montenegro are added to the UK red list.

item.title: Scottish court dismisses Clara Ponsati extradition case
item.description: A judge in Edinburgh has ruled Scottish courts have no jurisdiction over the extradition of the MEP to face a charge in Spain.

item.title: Scottish Greens co-leaders Harvie and Slater to be given minister roles
item.description: The Scottish Green Party confirms that Patrick Harvie and Lorna Slater will become ministers if a new power-sharing deal is approved.

item.title: Nicola Sturgeon's sister states charges dropped over house incident
item.description: Gillian Sturgeon was arrested along with her ex-partner over an alleged domestic incident in North Ayrshire.

item.title: Custard to be reinstated in Aberdeenshire after school petition
item.description: Aberdeenshire pupils took action to reinstate their favourite puddings, described as the "best in the world".

item.title: Covid in Scotland: Borders moves to essential hospital visits only
item.description: The move is made by NHS Borders with health services in the region under "immense pressure".

item.title: Hong Kong $5 note fetches Â£130,000 at auction
item.description: The 161-year-old banknote was signed by a Scot who rose to become manager of the entire corporation.

item.title: Drug dealer jailed for catalogue of sex attacks in the Borders
item.description: John Tunnicliffe, 56, raped three women and sexually assaulted a man in the Scottish Borders.

item.title: Covid in Scotland: Third of all Highland schools affected
item.description: Grantown, Lochaber and Culloden secondaries are among schools with "significant numbers" of pupils self-isolating.

item.title: Edinburgh construction worker crushed under lift
item.description: The man suffered broken ribs in the incident at the Johnnie Walker construction site in Edinburgh.

item.title: Covid in Scotland: Almost 40% of 16 and 17-year-olds receive vaccine
item.description: The Scottish government hopes to have offered everyone in the age group a first dose by late September.

item.title: Covid jab response low for some immunosuppressed people
item.description: Some high risk patients had few or no infection-fighting antibodies in their blood, a vaccine study found.

item.title: Covid in Scotland: What are the rules?
item.description: Scotland's levels system of restrictions have come to an end - but what does that mean people can do?

item.title: Covid: Is Scotland lagging behind on vaccine certificates?
item.description: A digital "passport" has been rolled out across the EU - so why does Scotland use a paper system?

item.title: Covid in Scotland: Your questions answered on life after level zero
item.description: Readers have been sending in their questions about what the ending of more Covid rules means for them.

item.title: Covid in Scotland: Are young people slowing the vaccine drive?
item.description: Concerns have been raised about vaccine uptake among younger adults, but are they less likely to want a jab? Here, we examine the statistics.

item.title: Covid map: Coronavirus cases, deaths, vaccinations by country
item.description: Key maps and charts explaining how the virus has spread around the world.

item.title: John McAleese: The SAS soldier who was the man behind the mask
item.description: John McAleese was the Scots soldier watched by millions on live television in the Iranian Embassy raid.

item.title: Golden eagle numbers surge in southern Scotland
item.description: A repopulation project successfully relocates eight more chicks to the area from the Highlands.

item.title: Club completes challenge to bag all 282 Munros in a single day
item.description: Members of Carnethy Hill Running Club reached the summits of all 282 mountains in a single day.

item.title: How will SNP-Greens deal affect plans for the A96?
item.description: The SNP and Scottish Greens have agreed a power-sharing arrangement, but with "distinct positions" on the A96's future.

item.title: Billy Connolly: Challenges of Parkinson's getting worse
item.description: The 78-year-old has retired from live performances and says that making TV programmes is getting more challenging.

item.title: Footage shows fire damage to Edinburgh 'Harry Potter' cafe
item.description: An early morning blaze caused fire, smoke and water damage to a cafe made famous by Harry Potter author JK Rowling.

item.title: Tokyo Paralympics: Aileen McGlynn and Helen Scott win silver in 1000m time trial
item.description: Watch Aileen McGlynn and pilot Helen Scott win silver for ParalympicsGB in the women's B 1000m time trial at the Izu Velodrome on day two of the Tokyo 2020 Paralympic Games.

item.title: Billy Connolly: Challenges of Parkinson's getting worse
item.description: The 78-year old has retired from live performances and says that making TV programmes is getting more difficult.

item.title: SNP and Greens seal power-sharing deal
item.description: The SNP and the Scottish Greens set out their power-sharing deal for Holyrood.

item.title: Film buff rescues more than 20,000 VHS tapes set for dump
item.description: A video shop owner travelled from Liverpool to Dundee to pick up the massive haul from a collector.

item.title: Alashkert 0-0 Rangers (0-1 agg): Ibrox club into Europa League group stages
item.description: Rangers overcome a Covid outbreak, stifling heat, and a limited 10-man Alashkert to clinch a Europa League group stage place for the fourth consecutive season.

item.title: Tokyo Paralympics: Scots Fin Graham & Aileen McGlynn take cycling silvers for Paralympics GB
item.description: Scots Fin Graham and Aileen McGlynn have secured cycling silver medals for for Paralympics GB at the Tokyo Games.

item.title: Tokyo Paralympics: Stef Reid on Scrabble in prison, lockdown baking & breaking barriers
item.description: Great Britain's Stef Reid tells BBC Sport about playing Scrabble with prison inmates, making the world's best cookies, and her mindset ahead of competing in the Tokyo Paralympics.
